Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: Small wheel-turned ovoid jar, made of Nile clay with a high percentage of mineral temper. The neck is broad, the mouth has a widened lip. The surface has been polished with a brick-red slip that has disappeared almost everywhere.  This vase might be a local imitation of  contemporary imports from Upper or Lower Egypt.
